document_data.name: Piddle
document_data.mainbody:
'''Booyagh Piddle''' was a [[goblin]] [[spellcaster]] and a devout follower of [[the Absolute]] during the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
{{Quote|Sez here that [[goblinoids]] are obstreperous and malodorous. What's that mean?|Piddle, reading a book about goblins.}}
document_data.Personality: Unlike many other goblins, Piddle was literate in [[Common]] and had a fairly robust vocabulary that he sought to expand.
document_data.Abilities: On occasion, Piddle distracted himself from his [[cleric]]al duties by spending time learning new information.
document_data.Possessions: After he and his fellow goblins abducted the famed writer [[Volothamp Geddarm]], Piddle got his hands on a copy of his latest unpublished manuscript, ''[[On Goblins: My Life Among the Conquering Host]]''.
document_data.Relationships: He was subordinate to Priestess [[Gut]] and was in awe of the tremendous power bestowed upon her by the Absolute.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, the goblinoid cultists of the Absolute sacked the [[Waukeen's Rest]] inn and made their way back to the [[Shattered Sanctum]] to celebrate. Piddle kept away from drinking, fighting, and chasing [[chicken]]s, preferring to pass his time deep in study.
